definitions.definition: A manner of transporting or lifting something; the grip or position in which something is carried.
definitions.example: Adjust your carry from time to time so that you don't tire too quickly.

definitions.definition: A tract of land over which boats or goods are carried between two bodies of navigable water; a portage.
The bit or digit that is carried in an addition operation.
The benefit or cost of owning an asset over time.
definitions.example: The carry on this trade is 25 basis points per annum.

definitions.definition: The distance travelled by the ball when struck, until it hits the ground.
Carried interest.
The sky; cloud-drift.
To lift (something) and take it to another place; to transport (something) by lifting.
To transfer from one place (such as a country, book, or column) to another.
definitions.example: to carry an account to the ledger

definitions.definition: To convey by extension or continuance; to extend.
definitions.example: The builders are going to carry the chimney through the roof.  They would have carried the road ten miles further, but ran out of materials.

definitions.definition: To move; to convey using force
To lead or guide.
To stock or supply (something); to have in store.
definitions.example: The corner drugstore doesn't carry his favorite brand of aspirin.

definitions.definition: To adopt (something); take (something) over.
definitions.example: I think I can carry Smith's work while she is out.

definitions.definition: To adopt or resolve on, especially in a deliberative assembly
In an addition, to transfer the quantity in excess of what is countable in the units in a column to the column immediately to the left in order to be added there.
definitions.example: Five and nine are fourteen; carry the one to the tens place.

definitions.definition: To have, hold, possess or maintain (something).
definitions.example: Always carry sufficient insurance to protect against a loss.

definitions.definition: To be transmitted; to travel.
definitions.example: The sound of the bells carried for miles on the wind.

definitions.definition: To insult, to diss.
To capture a ship by coming alongside and boarding.
To transport (the ball) whilst maintaining possession.
To have on one's person.
definitions.example: she always carries a purse;  marsupials carry their young in a pouch

definitions.definition: To be pregnant (with).
definitions.example: The doctor said she's carrying twins.

definitions.definition: To have propulsive power; to propel.
definitions.example: A gun or mortar carries well.

definitions.definition: To hold the head; said of a horse.
definitions.example: to carry well, i.e. to hold the head high, with arching neck

definitions.definition: To have earth or frost stick to the feet when running, as a hare.
To bear or uphold successfully through conflict, for example a leader or principle
To succeed in (e.g. a contest); to succeed in; to win.
To get possession of by force; to capture.
To contain; to comprise; have a particular aspect; to show or exhibit
To bear (oneself); to behave or conduct.
To bear the charges or burden of holding or having, as stocks, merchandise, etc., from one time to another.
definitions.example: A merchant is carrying a large stock;  a farm carries a mortgage;  a broker carries stock for a customer;  to carry a life insurance.

definitions.definition: To have a weapon on one's person; to be armed.
To be disproportionately responsible for a team's success.
definitions.example: He absolutely carried the game, to the point of killing the entire enemy team by himself.
